decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building a board of small, aggressive creatures while using equipment like Maul of the Skyclaves to pump them up. Cards like Luminarch Aspirant and Usher of the Fallen help to quickly establish a threatening board presence. Protection is provided by cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and efficient combat tricks, while also having the option to recur important cards with Lurrus of the Dream-Den.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and dealing direct damage to the opponent. By using cards that boost damage output like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and end the game swiftly. The snow-covered mountains provide flexibility and allow for additional damage from Frost Bite. Faceless Haven provides a way to create a creature when needed, while also benefiting from any creature buffs in the deck. Overall, the strategy is to be fast, efficient, and relentless in dealing damage.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using creature cards with haste, trample, and powerful abilities. By combining creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast with powerful equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Goldspan Dragon and Questing Beast provide additional threats and versatility to the deck, ensuring that it has multiple ways to win games efficiently. The land base is carefully organized to support the aggressive strategy and ensure consistent mana production.

The main idea behind this deck is to put pressure on the opponent early and often with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. Using a combination of low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Bonecrusher Giant, along with powerful threats like Goldspan Dragon and Embercleave, this deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming the opponent with damage. The inclusion of snow lands allows for additional synergy with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven, providing additional reach and versatility in combat. The goal is to consistently apply pressure and push through damage to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient creatures and equipment to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It aims to establish a board presence early on, utilize removal spells to clear the way for attacks, and maintain pressure throughout the game. The key strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing resources, prioritizing tempo and board control to put the opponent on the back foot and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and attacking the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to establish a board presence early with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant, and then pump them up with Embercleave for big damage. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and ramp, while Shatterskull Smashing and The Akroan War help to clear the way for attacks. Fabled Passage helps fix mana and trigger landfall abilities, allowing for explosive turns. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and combat tricks.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently to pressure the opponent and seize victory before they can stabilize. Key cards like Embercleave, Goldspan Dragon, and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell provide extra damage and power to your board, while cards like Frost Bite and Shatterskull Smashing help to remove threats from the opponent's side. With a strong curve and efficient creatures, this deck can quickly close out games.

The main aim of this deck is to control the game through various removal spells and counterspells, while also ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for extra value and card advantage. The deck also includes powerful cards like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Alrund's Epiphany to close out the game. The mana base is set up to consistently hit all the necessary colors for the deck's spells and abilities.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a board presence and then use Zenith Flare as a finisher. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Improbable Alliance, Drannith Stinger, and Flourishing Fox to generate tokens and deal damage, while also cycling through the deck with cards like Frostveil Ambush and Memory Leak. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to continually recast cheap cycling cards from your graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a mix of aggro creatures and direct damage from Zenith Flare.

The deck focuses on aggressive play using cycling cards to quickly build a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is a powerful companion that allows you to play permanent cycling cards from your graveyard. The key strategy is to cycle through your deck efficiently to find key cards like Zenith Flare and pump up your creatures with effects like Valiant Rescuer and Flourishing Fox. The deck also includes some disruption and protection spells to help maintain your tempo and pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on generating early pressure with efficient and powerful creatures like Rimrock Knight and Lovestruck Beast, supported by card draw from Edgewall Innkeeper. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive start, finishing them off with cards like Embercleave and Goldspan Dragon. The inclusion of removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and The Akroan War helps to maintain board control while keeping the pressure up. The mana base allows for consistent mana production and flexibility in casting spells. It's all about delivering a relentless onslaught and closing out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to control the board. By curving out with powerful creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Goldspan Dragon, while also using cards like Embercleave to give them an extra punch, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like The Akroan War and Esika's Chariot provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure. Overall, the deck aims to win through speed and efficiency in combat.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while using powerful creatures like Ascendant Spirit and Faceless Haven to apply pressure on the opponent. With a heavy reliance on snow-covered Islands and snow permanents, the deck aims to take advantage of synergies with Frost Augur and Saw It Coming. By utilizing cards like Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon, the deck can generate card advantage and create threatening board states to close out the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad, Elder Gargaroth, and Gadwick, the Wizened. The deck also includes powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game. With a well-balanced mana base and a mix of versatile spells, this Sultai Control deck is designed to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on using control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional value through blinking permanents. Vorinclex and Valki offer threats and disruption, with Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon providing additional win conditions. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by efficiently managing resources and controlling the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes Emergent Ultimatum to search for powerful game-winning cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon or Kiora Bests the Sea God. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents and generating card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.
